bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, To the Honorable the Judges of the District Court of the United States for the District of Alaska, Second Division
div1.p: WHEREAS, lately in the District Court of the United States for the District of Alaska, Second Division before you, or some of you, in a cause between the THE UNITED STATES OF AMERICA, Plaintiff, and GEORGE HAWKINS, Defendant, a judgment was entered on the 22nd day of March, 1901, in favor of the said plaintiff and against the said defendant, which said judgment is of record in said cause in the office of the Clerk of said District Court (to which record reference is hereby made and the same is hereby expressly made a part hereof) as by the inspection of the transcript of the record of the said District Court, which was brought into the United States Circuit Court of Appeal for the Ninth Circuit by virtue of a writ of error agreeably to the act of Congress in such cases made and provided, fully and at large appears:

AND WHEREAS, on the 27th day of February in the year of our Lord one thousand, nine hundred and two, the said . cause came on to be heard before the said Circuit Court of Appeals, on the said transcript of record and was argued by counsel:

ON CONSIDERATION WHEREOF, It is now hereby ordered and adjudged by this Court, that the judgment of the said District Court in this cause be, and the same is hereby, reversed, and the cause remanded for a new trial.
You, therefore, are hereby commanded that such further

Proceedings be had in said cause, in accordance with the opinion and judgment of this court, and as according to right and justice and the laws of the United States ought to be had, the said judgment of said District Court notwithstanding.
WITNESS, the Honorable MELVILLE W. FULLER, Chief Justice of the United States, the 21st day of June, in the year of our Lord one thousand, nine hundred and two.
div1.ab: F. D. MONCKTON, Clerk of the United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
div1.p: Endorsed: 49 Crim. No.77. United States Circuit Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit. George Hawkins vs. The United States. Mandate. Filed in the Office of the Clerk of the U.S.Dist. Court, Alaska, Second Division, at Nome, Alaska, Jul 31 1902 Geo. V. Berchsenius, Clerk, By H.C. Gordon Deputy Clerk. Journal 2. Page 275.
